00072 static spinlock_t krb5_seq_lock;
00073 
00074 struct krb5_enctype {
00075         char           *ke_dispname;
00076         char           *ke_enc_name;            /* linux tfm name */
00077         char           *ke_hash_name;           /* linux tfm name */
00078         int             ke_enc_mode;            /* linux tfm mode */
00079         int             ke_hash_size;           /* checksum size */
00080         int             ke_conf_size;           /* confounder size */
00081         unsigned int    ke_hash_hmac:1;         /* is hmac? */
00082 };
00083 
00084 /*
00085  * NOTE: for aes128-cts and aes256-cts, MIT implementation use CTS encryption.
00086  * but currently we simply CBC with padding, because linux doesn't support CTS
00087  * yet. this need to be fixed in the future.
00088  */
00089 static struct krb5_enctype enctypes[] = {
00090         [ENCTYPE_DES_CBC_RAW] = {               /* des-cbc-md5 */
00091                 "des-cbc-md5",
00092                 "cbc(des)",
00093                 "md5",
00094                 0,
00095                 16,
00096                 8,
00097                 0,
00098         },
00099         [ENCTYPE_DES3_CBC_RAW] = {              /* des3-hmac-sha1 */
00100                 "des3-hmac-sha1",
00101                 "cbc(des3_ede)",
00102                 "hmac(sha1)",
00103                 0,
00104                 20,
00105                 8,
00106                 1,
00107         },
00108         [ENCTYPE_AES128_CTS_HMAC_SHA1_96] = {   /* aes128-cts */
00109                 "aes128-cts-hmac-sha1-96",
00110                 "cbc(aes)",
00111                 "hmac(sha1)",
00112                 0,
00113                 12,
00114                 16,
00115                 1,
00116         },
00117         [ENCTYPE_AES256_CTS_HMAC_SHA1_96] = {   /* aes256-cts */
00118                 "aes256-cts-hmac-sha1-96",
00119                 "cbc(aes)",
00120                 "hmac(sha1)",
00121                 0,
00122                 12,
00123                 16,
00124                 1,
00125         },
00126         [ENCTYPE_ARCFOUR_HMAC] = {              /* arcfour-hmac-md5 */
00127                 "arcfour-hmac-md5",
00128                 "ecb(arc4)",
00129                 "hmac(md5)",
00130                 0,
00131                 16,
00132                 8,
00133                 1,
00134         },
00135 };
00136 
00137 #define MAX_ENCTYPES    sizeof(enctypes)/sizeof(struct krb5_enctype)
00138 
00139 static const char * enctype2str(__u32 enctype)
00140 {
00141         if (enctype < MAX_ENCTYPES && enctypes[enctype].ke_dispname)
00142                 return enctypes[enctype].ke_dispname;
00143 
00144         return "unknown";
00145 }
00146 
00147 static
00148 int keyblock_init(struct krb5_keyblock *kb, char *alg_name, int alg_mode)
00149 {
00150         kb->kb_tfm = crypto_alloc_blkcipher(alg_name, alg_mode, 0);
00151         if (IS_ERR(kb->kb_tfm)) {
00152                 CERROR("failed to alloc tfm: %s, mode %d\n",
00153                        alg_name, alg_mode);
00154                 return -1;
00155         }
00156 
00157         if (crypto_blkcipher_setkey(kb->kb_tfm, kb->kb_key.data, kb->kb_key.len)) {
00158                 CERROR("failed to set %s key, len %d\n",
00159                        alg_name, kb->kb_key.len);
00160                 return -1;
00161         }
00162 
00163         return 0;
00164 }
00165 
00166 static
00167 int krb5_init_keys(struct krb5_ctx *kctx)
00168 {
00169         struct krb5_enctype *ke;
00170 
00171         if (kctx->kc_enctype >= MAX_ENCTYPES ||
00172             enctypes[kctx->kc_enctype].ke_hash_size == 0) {
00173                 CERROR("unsupported enctype %x\n", kctx->kc_enctype);
00174                 return -1;
00175         }
00176 
00177         ke = &enctypes[kctx->kc_enctype];
00178 
00179         /* tfm arc4 is stateful, user should alloc-use-free by his own */
00180         if (kctx->kc_enctype != ENCTYPE_ARCFOUR_HMAC &&
00181             keyblock_init(&kctx->kc_keye, ke->ke_enc_name, ke->ke_enc_mode))
00182                 return -1;
00183 
00184         /* tfm hmac is stateful, user should alloc-use-free by his own */
00185         if (ke->ke_hash_hmac == 0 &&
00186             keyblock_init(&kctx->kc_keyi, ke->ke_enc_name, ke->ke_enc_mode))
00187                 return -1;
00188         if (ke->ke_hash_hmac == 0 &&
00189             keyblock_init(&kctx->kc_keyc, ke->ke_enc_name, ke->ke_enc_mode))
00190                 return -1;
00191 
00192         return 0;
00193 }
00194 
00195 static
00196 void keyblock_free(struct krb5_keyblock *kb)
00197 {
00198         rawobj_free(&kb->kb_key);
00199         if (kb->kb_tfm)
00200                 crypto_free_blkcipher(kb->kb_tfm);
00201 }
00202 
00203 static
00204 int keyblock_dup(struct krb5_keyblock *new, struct krb5_keyblock *kb)
00205 {
00206         return rawobj_dup(&new->kb_key, &kb->kb_key);
00207 }
00208 
00209 static
00210 int get_bytes(char **ptr, const char *end, void *res, int len)
00211 {
00212         char *p, *q;
00213         p = *ptr;
00214         q = p + len;
00215         if (q > end || q < p)
00216                 return -1;
00217         memcpy(res, p, len);
00218         *ptr = q;
00219         return 0;
00220 }
00221 
00222 static
00223 int get_rawobj(char **ptr, const char *end, rawobj_t *res)
00224 {
00225         char   *p, *q;
00226         __u32   len;
00227 
00228         p = *ptr;
00229         if (get_bytes(&p, end, &len, sizeof(len)))
00230                 return -1;
00231 
00232         q = p + len;
00233         if (q > end || q < p)
00234                 return -1;
00235 
00236         OBD_ALLOC_LARGE(res->data, len);
00237         if (!res->data)
00238                 return -1;
00239 
00240         res->len = len;
00241         memcpy(res->data, p, len);
00242         *ptr = q;
00243         return 0;
00244 }
00245 
00246 static
00247 int get_keyblock(char **ptr, const char *end,
00248                  struct krb5_keyblock *kb, __u32 keysize)
00249 {
00250         char *buf;
00251 
00252         OBD_ALLOC_LARGE(buf, keysize);
00253         if (buf == NULL)
00254                 return -1;
00255 
00256         if (get_bytes(ptr, end, buf, keysize)) {
00257                 OBD_FREE_LARGE(buf, keysize);
00258                 return -1;
00259         }
00260 
00261         kb->kb_key.len = keysize;
00262         kb->kb_key.data = buf;
00263         return 0;
00264 }
00265 
00266 static
00267 void delete_context_kerberos(struct krb5_ctx *kctx)
00268 {
00269         rawobj_free(&kctx->kc_mech_used);
00270 
00271         keyblock_free(&kctx->kc_keye);
00272         keyblock_free(&kctx->kc_keyi);
00273         keyblock_free(&kctx->kc_keyc);
00274 }
00275 
00276 static
00277 __u32 import_context_rfc1964(struct krb5_ctx *kctx, char *p, char *end)
00278 {
00279         unsigned int    tmp_uint, keysize;
00280 
00281         /* seed_init flag */
00282         if (get_bytes(&p, end, &tmp_uint, sizeof(tmp_uint)))
00283                 goto out_err;
00284         kctx->kc_seed_init = (tmp_uint != 0);
00285 
00286         /* seed */
00287         if (get_bytes(&p, end, kctx->kc_seed, sizeof(kctx->kc_seed)))
00288                 goto out_err;
00289 
00290         /* sign/seal algorithm, not really used now */
00291         if (get_bytes(&p, end, &tmp_uint, sizeof(tmp_uint)) ||
00292             get_bytes(&p, end, &tmp_uint, sizeof(tmp_uint)))
00293                 goto out_err;
00294 
00295         /* end time */
00296         if (get_bytes(&p, end, &kctx->kc_endtime, sizeof(kctx->kc_endtime)))
00297                 goto out_err;
00298 
00299         /* seq send */
00300         if (get_bytes(&p, end, &tmp_uint, sizeof(tmp_uint)))
00301                 goto out_err;
00302         kctx->kc_seq_send = tmp_uint;
00303 
00304         /* mech oid */
00305         if (get_rawobj(&p, end, &kctx->kc_mech_used))
00306                 goto out_err;
00307 
00308         /* old style enc/seq keys in format:
00309          *   - enctype (u32)
00310          *   - keysize (u32)
00311          *   - keydata
00312          * we decompose them to fit into the new context
00313          */
00314 
00315         /* enc key */
00316         if (get_bytes(&p, end, &kctx->kc_enctype, sizeof(kctx->kc_enctype)))
00317                 goto out_err;
00318 
00319         if (get_bytes(&p, end, &keysize, sizeof(keysize)))
00320                 goto out_err;
00321 
00322         if (get_keyblock(&p, end, &kctx->kc_keye, keysize))
00323                 goto out_err;
00324 
00325         /* seq key */
00326         if (get_bytes(&p, end, &tmp_uint, sizeof(tmp_uint)) ||
00327             tmp_uint != kctx->kc_enctype)
00328                 goto out_err;
00329 
00330         if (get_bytes(&p, end, &tmp_uint, sizeof(tmp_uint)) ||
00331             tmp_uint != keysize)
00332                 goto out_err;
00333 
00334         if (get_keyblock(&p, end, &kctx->kc_keyc, keysize))
00335                 goto out_err;
00336 
00337         /* old style fallback */
00338         if (keyblock_dup(&kctx->kc_keyi, &kctx->kc_keyc))
00339                 goto out_err;
00340 
00341         if (p != end)
00342                 goto out_err;
00343 
00344         CDEBUG(D_SEC, "successfully imported rfc1964 context\n");
00345         return 0;
00346 out_err:
00347         return GSS_S_FAILURE;
00348 }
00349 
00350 /* Flags for version 2 context flags */
00351 #define KRB5_CTX_FLAG_INITIATOR         0x00000001
00352 #define KRB5_CTX_FLAG_CFX               0x00000002
00353 #define KRB5_CTX_FLAG_ACCEPTOR_SUBKEY   0x00000004
00354 
00355 static
00356 __u32 import_context_rfc4121(struct krb5_ctx *kctx, char *p, char *end)
00357 {
00358         unsigned int    tmp_uint, keysize;
00359 
00360         /* end time */
00361         if (get_bytes(&p, end, &kctx->kc_endtime, sizeof(kctx->kc_endtime)))
00362                 goto out_err;
00363 
00364         /* flags */
00365         if (get_bytes(&p, end, &tmp_uint, sizeof(tmp_uint)))
00366                 goto out_err;
00367 
00368         if (tmp_uint & KRB5_CTX_FLAG_INITIATOR)
00369                 kctx->kc_initiate = 1;
00370         if (tmp_uint & KRB5_CTX_FLAG_CFX)
00371                 kctx->kc_cfx = 1;
00372         if (tmp_uint & KRB5_CTX_FLAG_ACCEPTOR_SUBKEY)
00373                 kctx->kc_have_acceptor_subkey = 1;
00374 
00375         /* seq send */
00376         if (get_bytes(&p, end, &kctx->kc_seq_send, sizeof(kctx->kc_seq_send)))
00377                 goto out_err;
00378 
00379         /* enctype */
00380         if (get_bytes(&p, end, &kctx->kc_enctype, sizeof(kctx->kc_enctype)))
00381                 goto out_err;
00382 
00383         /* size of each key */
00384         if (get_bytes(&p, end, &keysize, sizeof(keysize)))
00385                 goto out_err;
00386 
00387         /* number of keys - should always be 3 */
00388         if (get_bytes(&p, end, &tmp_uint, sizeof(tmp_uint)))
00389                 goto out_err;
00390 
00391         if (tmp_uint != 3) {
00392                 CERROR("Invalid number of keys: %u\n", tmp_uint);
00393                 goto out_err;
00394         }
00395 
00396         /* ke */
00397         if (get_keyblock(&p, end, &kctx->kc_keye, keysize))
00398                 goto out_err;
00399         /* ki */
00400         if (get_keyblock(&p, end, &kctx->kc_keyi, keysize))
00401                 goto out_err;
00402         /* ki */
00403         if (get_keyblock(&p, end, &kctx->kc_keyc, keysize))
00404                 goto out_err;
00405 
00406         CDEBUG(D_SEC, "successfully imported v2 context\n");
00407         return 0;
00408 out_err:
00409         return GSS_S_FAILURE;
00410 }
00411 
00412 /*
00413  * The whole purpose here is trying to keep user level gss context parsing
00414  * from nfs-utils unchanged as possible as we can, they are not quite mature
00415  * yet, and many stuff still not clear, like heimdal etc.
00416  */
00417 static
00418 __u32 gss_import_sec_context_kerberos(rawobj_t *inbuf,
00419                                       struct gss_ctx *gctx)
00420 {
00421         struct krb5_ctx *kctx;
00422         char            *p = (char *) inbuf->data;
00423         char            *end = (char *) (inbuf->data + inbuf->len);
00424         unsigned int     tmp_uint, rc;
00425 
00426         if (get_bytes(&p, end, &tmp_uint, sizeof(tmp_uint))) {
00427                 CERROR("Fail to read version\n");
00428                 return GSS_S_FAILURE;
00429         }
00430 
00431         /* only support 0, 1 for the moment */
00432         if (tmp_uint > 2) {
00433                 CERROR("Invalid version %u\n", tmp_uint);
00434                 return GSS_S_FAILURE;
00435         }
00436 
00437         OBD_ALLOC_PTR(kctx);
00438         if (!kctx)
00439                 return GSS_S_FAILURE;
00440 
00441         if (tmp_uint == 0 || tmp_uint == 1) {
00442                 kctx->kc_initiate = tmp_uint;
00443                 rc = import_context_rfc1964(kctx, p, end);
00444         } else {
00445                 rc = import_context_rfc4121(kctx, p, end);
00446         }
00447 
00448         if (rc == 0)
00449                 rc = krb5_init_keys(kctx);
00450 
00451         if (rc) {
00452                 delete_context_kerberos(kctx);
00453                 OBD_FREE_PTR(kctx);
00454 
00455                 return GSS_S_FAILURE;
00456         }
00457 
00458         gctx->internal_ctx_id = kctx;
00459         return GSS_S_COMPLETE;
00460 }
00461 
00462 static
00463 __u32 gss_copy_reverse_context_kerberos(struct gss_ctx *gctx,
00464                                         struct gss_ctx *gctx_new)
00465 {
00466         struct krb5_ctx *kctx = gctx->internal_ctx_id;
00467         struct krb5_ctx *knew;
00468 
00469         OBD_ALLOC_PTR(knew);
00470         if (!knew)
00471                 return GSS_S_FAILURE;
00472 
00473         knew->kc_initiate = kctx->kc_initiate ? 0 : 1;
00474         knew->kc_cfx = kctx->kc_cfx;
00475         knew->kc_seed_init = kctx->kc_seed_init;
00476         knew->kc_have_acceptor_subkey = kctx->kc_have_acceptor_subkey;
00477         knew->kc_endtime = kctx->kc_endtime;
00478 
00479         memcpy(knew->kc_seed, kctx->kc_seed, sizeof(kctx->kc_seed));
00480         knew->kc_seq_send = kctx->kc_seq_recv;
00481         knew->kc_seq_recv = kctx->kc_seq_send;
00482         knew->kc_enctype = kctx->kc_enctype;
00483 
00484         if (rawobj_dup(&knew->kc_mech_used, &kctx->kc_mech_used))
00485                 goto out_err;
00486 
00487         if (keyblock_dup(&knew->kc_keye, &kctx->kc_keye))
00488                 goto out_err;
00489         if (keyblock_dup(&knew->kc_keyi, &kctx->kc_keyi))
00490                 goto out_err;
00491         if (keyblock_dup(&knew->kc_keyc, &kctx->kc_keyc))
00492                 goto out_err;
00493         if (krb5_init_keys(knew))
00494                 goto out_err;
00495 
00496         gctx_new->internal_ctx_id = knew;
00497         CDEBUG(D_SEC, "successfully copied reverse context\n");
00498         return GSS_S_COMPLETE;
00499 
00500 out_err:
00501         delete_context_kerberos(knew);
00502         OBD_FREE_PTR(knew);
00503         return GSS_S_FAILURE;
00504 }
00505 
00506 static
00507 __u32 gss_inquire_context_kerberos(struct gss_ctx *gctx,
00508                                    unsigned long  *endtime)
00509 {
00510         struct krb5_ctx *kctx = gctx->internal_ctx_id;
00511 
00512         *endtime = (unsigned long) ((__u32) kctx->kc_endtime);
00513         return GSS_S_COMPLETE;
00514 }
00515 
00516 static
00517 void gss_delete_sec_context_kerberos(void *internal_ctx)
00518 {
00519         struct krb5_ctx *kctx = internal_ctx;
00520 
00521         delete_context_kerberos(kctx);
00522         OBD_FREE_PTR(kctx);
00523 }
00524 
00525 /*
00526  * Should be used for buffers allocated with k/vmalloc().
00527  *
00528  * Dispose of @sgt with teardown_sgtable().
00529  *
00530  * @prealloc_sg is to avoid memory allocation inside sg_alloc_table()
00531  * in cases where a single sg is sufficient.  No attempt to reduce the
00532  * number of sgs by squeezing physically contiguous pages together is
00533  * made though, for simplicity.
00534  *
00535  * This function is copied from the ceph filesystem code.
00536  */
00537 static int setup_sgtable(struct sg_table *sgt, struct scatterlist *prealloc_sg,
00538                          const void *buf, unsigned int buf_len)
00539 {
00540         struct scatterlist *sg;
00541         const bool is_vmalloc = is_vmalloc_addr(buf);
00542         unsigned int off = offset_in_page(buf);
00543         unsigned int chunk_cnt = 1;
00544         unsigned int chunk_len = PAGE_ALIGN(off + buf_len);
00545         int i;
00546         int ret;
00547 
00548         if (buf_len == 0) {
00549                 memset(sgt, 0, sizeof(*sgt));
00550                 return -EINVAL;
00551         }
00552 
00553         if (is_vmalloc) {
00554                 chunk_cnt = chunk_len >> PAGE_SHIFT;
00555                 chunk_len = PAGE_SIZE;
00556         }
00557 
00558         if (chunk_cnt > 1) {
00559                 ret = sg_alloc_table(sgt, chunk_cnt, GFP_NOFS);
00560                 if (ret)
00561                         return ret;
00562         } else {
00563                 WARN_ON(chunk_cnt != 1);
00564                 sg_init_table(prealloc_sg, 1);
00565                 sgt->sgl = prealloc_sg;
00566                 sgt->nents = sgt->orig_nents = 1;
00567         }
00568 
00569         for_each_sg(sgt->sgl, sg, sgt->orig_nents, i) {
00570                 struct page *page;
00571                 unsigned int len = min(chunk_len - off, buf_len);
00572 
00573                 if (is_vmalloc)
00574                         page = vmalloc_to_page(buf);
00575                 else
00576                         page = virt_to_page(buf);
00577 
00578                 sg_set_page(sg, page, len, off);
00579 
00580                 off = 0;
00581                 buf += len;
00582                 buf_len -= len;
00583         }
00584 
00585         WARN_ON(buf_len != 0);
00586 
00587         return 0;
00588 }
00589 
00590 static void teardown_sgtable(struct sg_table *sgt)
00591 {
00592         if (sgt->orig_nents > 1)
00593                 sg_free_table(sgt);
00594 }
00595 
00596 static
00597 __u32 krb5_encrypt(struct crypto_blkcipher *tfm,
00598                    int decrypt,
00599                    void * iv,
00600                    void * in,
00601                    void * out,
00602                    int length)
00603 {
00604         struct sg_table sg_out;
00605         struct blkcipher_desc desc;
00606         struct scatterlist    sg;
00607         __u8 local_iv[16] = {0};
00608         __u32 ret = -EINVAL;
00609 
00610         LASSERT(tfm);
00611         desc.tfm  = tfm;
00612         desc.info = local_iv;
00613         desc.flags= 0;
00614 
00615         if (length % crypto_blkcipher_blocksize(tfm) != 0) {
00616                 CERROR("output length %d mismatch blocksize %d\n",
00617                        length, crypto_blkcipher_blocksize(tfm));
00618                 goto out;
00619         }
00620 
00621         if (crypto_blkcipher_ivsize(tfm) > 16) {
00622                 CERROR("iv size too large %d\n", crypto_blkcipher_ivsize(tfm));
00623                 goto out;
00624         }
00625 
00626         if (iv)
00627                 memcpy(local_iv, iv, crypto_blkcipher_ivsize(tfm));
00628 
00629         memcpy(out, in, length);
00630 
00631         ret = setup_sgtable(&sg_out, &sg, out, length);
00632         if (ret != 0)
00633                 goto out;
00634 
00635         if (decrypt)
00636                 ret = crypto_blkcipher_decrypt_iv(&desc, sg_out.sgl,
00637                                                   sg_out.sgl, length);
00638         else
00639                 ret = crypto_blkcipher_encrypt_iv(&desc, sg_out.sgl,
00640                                                   sg_out.sgl, length);
00641 
00642         teardown_sgtable(&sg_out);
00643 out:
00644         return ret;
00645 }
00646 
00647 static inline
00648 int krb5_digest_hmac(struct crypto_hash *tfm,
00649                      rawobj_t *key,
00650                      struct krb5_header *khdr,
00651                      int msgcnt, rawobj_t *msgs,
00652                      int iovcnt, lnet_kiov_t *iovs,
00653                      rawobj_t *cksum)
00654 {
00655         struct hash_desc        desc;
00656         struct sg_table         sgt;
00657         struct scatterlist      sg[1];
00658         int                     i, rc;
00659 
00660         crypto_hash_setkey(tfm, key->data, key->len);
00661         desc.tfm  = tfm;
00662         desc.flags= 0;
00663 
00664         crypto_hash_init(&desc);
00665 
00666         for (i = 0; i < msgcnt; i++) {
00667                 if (msgs[i].len == 0)
00668                         continue;
00669 
00670                 rc = setup_sgtable(&sgt, sg, msgs[i].data, msgs[i].len);
00671                 if (rc != 0)
00672                         return rc;
00673 
00674                 crypto_hash_update(&desc, sgt.sgl, msgs[i].len);
00675 
00676                 teardown_sgtable(&sgt);
00677         }
00678 
00679         for (i = 0; i < iovcnt; i++) {
00680                 if (iovs[i].kiov_len == 0)
00681                         continue;
00682 
00683                 sg_init_table(sg, 1);
00684                 sg_set_page(&sg[0], iovs[i].kiov_page, iovs[i].kiov_len,
00685                             iovs[i].kiov_offset);
00686                 crypto_hash_update(&desc, sg, iovs[i].kiov_len);
00687         }
00688 
00689         if (khdr) {
00690                 rc = setup_sgtable(&sgt, sg, (char *) khdr, sizeof(*khdr));
00691                 if (rc != 0)
00692                         return rc;
00693 
00694                 crypto_hash_update(&desc, sgt.sgl, sizeof(*khdr));
00695 
00696                 teardown_sgtable(&sgt);
00697         }
00698 
00699         return crypto_hash_final(&desc, cksum->data);
00700 }
00701 
00702 static inline
00703 int krb5_digest_norm(struct crypto_hash *tfm,
00704                      struct krb5_keyblock *kb,
00705                      struct krb5_header *khdr,
00706                      int msgcnt, rawobj_t *msgs,
00707                      int iovcnt, lnet_kiov_t *iovs,
00708                      rawobj_t *cksum)
00709 {
00710         struct hash_desc        desc;
00711         struct scatterlist      sg[1];
00712         struct sg_table         sgt;
00713         int                     i, rc;
00714 
00715         LASSERT(kb->kb_tfm);
00716         desc.tfm  = tfm;
00717         desc.flags= 0;
00718 
00719         crypto_hash_init(&desc);
00720 
00721         for (i = 0; i < msgcnt; i++) {
00722                 if (msgs[i].len == 0)
00723                         continue;
00724 
00725                 rc = setup_sgtable(&sgt, sg, msgs[i].data, msgs[i].len);
00726                 if (rc != 0)
00727                         return rc;
00728 
00729                 crypto_hash_update(&desc, sgt.sgl, msgs[i].len);
00730 
00731                 teardown_sgtable(&sgt);
00732         }
00733 
00734         for (i = 0; i < iovcnt; i++) {
00735                 if (iovs[i].kiov_len == 0)
00736                         continue;
00737 
00738                 sg_init_table(sg, 1);
00739                 sg_set_page(&sg[0], iovs[i].kiov_page, iovs[i].kiov_len,
00740                             iovs[i].kiov_offset);
00741                 crypto_hash_update(&desc, sg, iovs[i].kiov_len);
00742         }
00743 
00744         if (khdr) {
00745                 rc = setup_sgtable(&sgt, sg, (char *) khdr, sizeof(*khdr));
00746                 if (rc != 0)
00747                         return rc;
00748 
00749                 crypto_hash_update(&desc, sgt.sgl, sizeof(*khdr));
00750 
00751                 teardown_sgtable(&sgt);
00752         }
00753 
00754         crypto_hash_final(&desc, cksum->data);
00755 
00756         return krb5_encrypt(kb->kb_tfm, 0, NULL, cksum->data,
00757                             cksum->data, cksum->len);
00758 }
00759 
00760 /*
00761  * compute (keyed/keyless) checksum against the plain text which appended
00762  * with krb5 wire token header.
00763  */
00764 static
00765 __s32 krb5_make_checksum(__u32 enctype,
00766                          struct krb5_keyblock *kb,
00767                          struct krb5_header *khdr,
00768                          int msgcnt, rawobj_t *msgs,
00769                          int iovcnt, lnet_kiov_t *iovs,
00770                          rawobj_t *cksum)
00771 {
00772         struct krb5_enctype   *ke = &enctypes[enctype];
00773         struct crypto_hash    *tfm;
00774         __u32                  code = GSS_S_FAILURE;
00775         int                    rc;
00776 
00777         if (!(tfm = crypto_alloc_hash(ke->ke_hash_name, 0, 0))) {
00778                 CERROR("failed to alloc TFM: %s\n", ke->ke_hash_name);
00779                 return GSS_S_FAILURE;
00780         }
00781 
00782         cksum->len = crypto_hash_digestsize(tfm);
00783         OBD_ALLOC_LARGE(cksum->data, cksum->len);
00784         if (!cksum->data) {
00785                 cksum->len = 0;
00786                 goto out_tfm;
00787         }
00788 
00789         if (ke->ke_hash_hmac)
00790                 rc = krb5_digest_hmac(tfm, &kb->kb_key,
00791                                       khdr, msgcnt, msgs, iovcnt, iovs, cksum);
00792         else
00793                 rc = krb5_digest_norm(tfm, kb,
00794                                       khdr, msgcnt, msgs, iovcnt, iovs, cksum);
00795 
00796         if (rc == 0)
00797                 code = GSS_S_COMPLETE;
00798 out_tfm:
00799         crypto_free_hash(tfm);
00800         return code;
00801 }
00802 
00803 static void fill_krb5_header(struct krb5_ctx *kctx,
00804                              struct krb5_header *khdr,
00805                              int privacy)
00806 {
00807         unsigned char acceptor_flag;
00808 
00809         acceptor_flag = kctx->kc_initiate ? 0 : FLAG_SENDER_IS_ACCEPTOR;
00810 
00811         if (privacy) {
00812                 khdr->kh_tok_id = cpu_to_be16(KG_TOK_WRAP_MSG);
00813                 khdr->kh_flags = acceptor_flag | FLAG_WRAP_CONFIDENTIAL;
00814                 khdr->kh_ec = cpu_to_be16(0);
00815                 khdr->kh_rrc = cpu_to_be16(0);
00816         } else {
00817                 khdr->kh_tok_id = cpu_to_be16(KG_TOK_MIC_MSG);
00818                 khdr->kh_flags = acceptor_flag;
00819                 khdr->kh_ec = cpu_to_be16(0xffff);
00820                 khdr->kh_rrc = cpu_to_be16(0xffff);
00821         }
00822 
00823         khdr->kh_filler = 0xff;
00824         spin_lock(&krb5_seq_lock);
00825         khdr->kh_seq = cpu_to_be64(kctx->kc_seq_send++);
00826         spin_unlock(&krb5_seq_lock);
00827 }
00828 
00829 static __u32 verify_krb5_header(struct krb5_ctx *kctx,
00830                                 struct krb5_header *khdr,
00831                                 int privacy)
00832 {
00833         unsigned char acceptor_flag;
00834         __u16         tok_id, ec_rrc;
00835 
00836         acceptor_flag = kctx->kc_initiate ? FLAG_SENDER_IS_ACCEPTOR : 0;
00837 
00838         if (privacy) {
00839                 tok_id = KG_TOK_WRAP_MSG;
00840                 ec_rrc = 0x0;
00841         } else {
00842                 tok_id = KG_TOK_MIC_MSG;
00843                 ec_rrc = 0xffff;
00844         }
00845 
00846         /* sanity checks */
00847         if (be16_to_cpu(khdr->kh_tok_id) != tok_id) {
00848                 CERROR("bad token id\n");
00849                 return GSS_S_DEFECTIVE_TOKEN;
00850         }
00851         if ((khdr->kh_flags & FLAG_SENDER_IS_ACCEPTOR) != acceptor_flag) {
00852                 CERROR("bad direction flag\n");
00853                 return GSS_S_BAD_SIG;
00854         }
00855         if (privacy && (khdr->kh_flags & FLAG_WRAP_CONFIDENTIAL) == 0) {
00856                 CERROR("missing confidential flag\n");
00857                 return GSS_S_BAD_SIG;
00858         }
00859         if (khdr->kh_filler != 0xff) {
00860                 CERROR("bad filler\n");
00861                 return GSS_S_DEFECTIVE_TOKEN;
00862         }
00863         if (be16_to_cpu(khdr->kh_ec) != ec_rrc ||
00864             be16_to_cpu(khdr->kh_rrc) != ec_rrc) {
00865                 CERROR("bad EC or RRC\n");
00866                 return GSS_S_DEFECTIVE_TOKEN;
00867         }
00868         return GSS_S_COMPLETE;
00869 }
00870 
00871 static
00872 __u32 gss_get_mic_kerberos(struct gss_ctx *gctx,
00873                            int msgcnt,
00874                            rawobj_t *msgs,
00875                            int iovcnt,
00876                            lnet_kiov_t *iovs,
00877                            rawobj_t *token)
00878 {
00879         struct krb5_ctx     *kctx = gctx->internal_ctx_id;
00880         struct krb5_enctype *ke = &enctypes[kctx->kc_enctype];
00881         struct krb5_header  *khdr;
00882         rawobj_t             cksum = RAWOBJ_EMPTY;
00883 
00884         /* fill krb5 header */
00885         LASSERT(token->len >= sizeof(*khdr));
00886         khdr = (struct krb5_header *) token->data;
00887         fill_krb5_header(kctx, khdr, 0);
00888 
00889         /* checksum */
00890         if (krb5_make_checksum(kctx->kc_enctype, &kctx->kc_keyc,
00891                                khdr, msgcnt, msgs, iovcnt, iovs, &cksum))
00892                 return GSS_S_FAILURE;
00893 
00894         LASSERT(cksum.len >= ke->ke_hash_size);
00895         LASSERT(token->len >= sizeof(*khdr) + ke->ke_hash_size);
00896         memcpy(khdr + 1, cksum.data + cksum.len - ke->ke_hash_size,
00897                ke->ke_hash_size);
00898 
00899         token->len = sizeof(*khdr) + ke->ke_hash_size;
00900         rawobj_free(&cksum);
00901         return GSS_S_COMPLETE;
00902 }
00903 
00904 static
00905 __u32 gss_verify_mic_kerberos(struct gss_ctx *gctx,
00906                               int msgcnt,
00907                               rawobj_t *msgs,
00908                               int iovcnt,
00909                               lnet_kiov_t *iovs,
00910                               rawobj_t *token)
00911 {
00912         struct krb5_ctx     *kctx = gctx->internal_ctx_id;
00913         struct krb5_enctype *ke = &enctypes[kctx->kc_enctype];
00914         struct krb5_header  *khdr;
00915         rawobj_t             cksum = RAWOBJ_EMPTY;
00916         __u32                major;
00917 
00918         if (token->len < sizeof(*khdr)) {
00919                 CERROR("short signature: %u\n", token->len);
00920                 return GSS_S_DEFECTIVE_TOKEN;
00921         }
00922 
00923         khdr = (struct krb5_header *) token->data;
00924 
00925         major = verify_krb5_header(kctx, khdr, 0);
00926         if (major != GSS_S_COMPLETE) {
00927                 CERROR("bad krb5 header\n");
00928                 return major;
00929         }
00930 
00931         if (token->len < sizeof(*khdr) + ke->ke_hash_size) {
00932                 CERROR("short signature: %u, require %d\n",
00933                        token->len, (int) sizeof(*khdr) + ke->ke_hash_size);
00934                 return GSS_S_FAILURE;
00935         }
00936 
00937         if (krb5_make_checksum(kctx->kc_enctype, &kctx->kc_keyc,
00938                                khdr, msgcnt, msgs, iovcnt, iovs, &cksum)) {
00939                 CERROR("failed to make checksum\n");
00940                 return GSS_S_FAILURE;
00941         }
00942 
00943         LASSERT(cksum.len >= ke->ke_hash_size);
00944         if (memcmp(khdr + 1, cksum.data + cksum.len - ke->ke_hash_size,
00945                    ke->ke_hash_size)) {
00946                 CERROR("checksum mismatch\n");
00947                 rawobj_free(&cksum);
00948                 return GSS_S_BAD_SIG;
00949         }
00950 
00951         rawobj_free(&cksum);
00952         return GSS_S_COMPLETE;
00953 }
00954 
00955 static
00956 int add_padding(rawobj_t *msg, int msg_buflen, int blocksize)
00957 {
00958         int padding;
00959 
00960         padding = (blocksize - (msg->len & (blocksize - 1))) &
00961                   (blocksize - 1);
00962         if (!padding)
00963                 return 0;
00964 
00965         if (msg->len + padding > msg_buflen) {
00966                 CERROR("bufsize %u too small: datalen %u, padding %u\n",
00967                         msg_buflen, msg->len, padding);
00968                 return -EINVAL;
00969         }
00970 
00971         memset(msg->data + msg->len, padding, padding);
00972         msg->len += padding;
00973         return 0;
00974 }
00975 
00976 static
00977 int krb5_encrypt_rawobjs(struct crypto_blkcipher *tfm,
00978                          int mode_ecb,
00979                          int inobj_cnt,
00980                          rawobj_t *inobjs,
00981                          rawobj_t *outobj,
00982                          int enc)
00983 {
00984         struct blkcipher_desc desc;
00985         struct scatterlist    src, dst;
00986         struct sg_table         sg_src, sg_dst;
00987         __u8                  local_iv[16] = {0}, *buf;
00988         __u32                 datalen = 0;
00989         int                   i, rc;
00990         ENTRY;
00991 
00992         buf = outobj->data;
00993         desc.tfm  = tfm;
00994         desc.info = local_iv;
00995         desc.flags = 0;
00996 
00997         for (i = 0; i < inobj_cnt; i++) {
00998                 LASSERT(buf + inobjs[i].len <= outobj->data + outobj->len);
00999 
01000                 rc = setup_sgtable(&sg_src, &src, inobjs[i].data,
01001                                    inobjs[i].len);
01002                 if (rc != 0)
01003                         RETURN(rc);
01004 
01005                 rc = setup_sgtable(&sg_dst, &dst, buf,
01006                                    outobj->len - datalen);
01007                 if (rc != 0) {
01008                         teardown_sgtable(&sg_src);
01009                         RETURN(rc);
01010                 }
01011 
01012                 if (mode_ecb) {
01013                         if (enc)
01014                                 rc = crypto_blkcipher_encrypt(&desc, sg_dst.sgl,
01015                                                               sg_src.sgl,
01016                                                               inobjs[i].len);
01017                         else
01018                                 rc = crypto_blkcipher_decrypt(&desc, sg_dst.sgl,
01019                                                               sg_src.sgl,
01020                                                               inobjs[i].len);
01021                 } else {
01022                         if (enc)
01023                                 rc = crypto_blkcipher_encrypt_iv(&desc,
01024                                                                  sg_dst.sgl,
01025                                                                  sg_src.sgl,
01026                                                                  inobjs[i].len);
01027                         else
01028                                 rc = crypto_blkcipher_decrypt_iv(&desc,
01029                                                                  sg_dst.sgl,
01030                                                                  sg_src.sgl,
01031                                                                  inobjs[i].len);
01032                 }
01033 
01034                 teardown_sgtable(&sg_src);
01035                 teardown_sgtable(&sg_dst);
01036 
01037                 if (rc) {
01038                         CERROR("encrypt error %d\n", rc);
01039                         RETURN(rc);
01040                 }
01041 
01042                 datalen += inobjs[i].len;
01043                 buf += inobjs[i].len;
01044         }
01045 
01046         outobj->len = datalen;
01047         RETURN(0);
01048 }
01049 
01050 /*
01051  * if adj_nob != 0, we adjust desc->bd_nob to the actual cipher text size.
01052  */
01053 static
01054 int krb5_encrypt_bulk(struct crypto_blkcipher *tfm,
01055                       struct krb5_header *khdr,
01056                       char *confounder,
01057                       struct ptlrpc_bulk_desc *desc,
01058                       rawobj_t *cipher,
01059                       int adj_nob)
01060 {
01061         struct blkcipher_desc   ciph_desc;
01062         __u8                    local_iv[16] = {0};
01063         struct scatterlist      src, dst;
01064         struct sg_table         sg_src, sg_dst;
01065         int                     blocksize, i, rc, nob = 0;
01066 
01067         LASSERT(ptlrpc_is_bulk_desc_kiov(desc->bd_type));
01068         LASSERT(desc->bd_iov_count);
01069         LASSERT(GET_ENC_KIOV(desc));
01070 
01071         blocksize = crypto_blkcipher_blocksize(tfm);
01072         LASSERT(blocksize > 1);
01073         LASSERT(cipher->len == blocksize + sizeof(*khdr));
01074 
01075         ciph_desc.tfm  = tfm;
01076         ciph_desc.info = local_iv;
01077         ciph_desc.flags = 0;
01078 
01079         /* encrypt confounder */
01080         rc = setup_sgtable(&sg_src, &src, confounder, blocksize);
01081         if (rc != 0)
01082                 return rc;
01083 
01084         rc = setup_sgtable(&sg_dst, &dst, cipher->data, blocksize);
01085         if (rc != 0) {
01086                 teardown_sgtable(&sg_src);
01087                 return rc;
01088         }
01089 
01090         rc = crypto_blkcipher_encrypt_iv(&ciph_desc, sg_dst.sgl,
01091                                          sg_src.sgl, blocksize);
01092 
01093         teardown_sgtable(&sg_dst);
01094         teardown_sgtable(&sg_src);
01095 
01096         if (rc) {
01097                 CERROR("error to encrypt confounder: %d\n", rc);
01098                 return rc;
01099         }
01100 
01101         /* encrypt clear pages */
01102         for (i = 0; i < desc->bd_iov_count; i++) {
01103                 sg_init_table(&src, 1);
01104                 sg_set_page(&src, BD_GET_KIOV(desc, i).kiov_page,
01105                             (BD_GET_KIOV(desc, i).kiov_len +
01106                                 blocksize - 1) &
01107                             (~(blocksize - 1)),
01108                             BD_GET_KIOV(desc, i).kiov_offset);
01109                 if (adj_nob)
01110                         nob += src.length;
01111                 sg_init_table(&dst, 1);
01112                 sg_set_page(&dst, BD_GET_ENC_KIOV(desc, i).kiov_page,
01113                             src.length, src.offset);
01114 
01115                 BD_GET_ENC_KIOV(desc, i).kiov_offset = dst.offset;
01116                 BD_GET_ENC_KIOV(desc, i).kiov_len = dst.length;
01117 
01118                 rc = crypto_blkcipher_encrypt_iv(&ciph_desc, &dst, &src,
01119                                                     src.length);
01120                 if (rc) {
01121                         CERROR("error to encrypt page: %d\n", rc);
01122                         return rc;
01123                 }
01124         }
01125 
01126         /* encrypt krb5 header */
01127         rc = setup_sgtable(&sg_src, &src, khdr, sizeof(*khdr));
01128         if (rc != 0)
01129                 return rc;
01130 
01131         rc = setup_sgtable(&sg_dst, &dst, cipher->data + blocksize,
01132                            sizeof(*khdr));
01133         if (rc != 0) {
01134                 teardown_sgtable(&sg_src);
01135                 return rc;
01136         }
01137 
01138         rc = crypto_blkcipher_encrypt_iv(&ciph_desc, sg_dst.sgl, sg_src.sgl,
01139                                          sizeof(*khdr));
01140 
01141         teardown_sgtable(&sg_dst);
01142         teardown_sgtable(&sg_src);
01143 
01144         if (rc) {
01145                 CERROR("error to encrypt krb5 header: %d\n", rc);
01146                 return rc;
01147         }
01148 
01149         if (adj_nob)
01150                 desc->bd_nob = nob;
01151 
01152         return 0;
01153 }
01154 
01155 /*
01156  * desc->bd_nob_transferred is the size of cipher text received.
01157  * desc->bd_nob is the target size of plain text supposed to be.
01158  *
01159  * if adj_nob != 0, we adjust each page's kiov_len to the actual
01160  * plain text size.
01161  * - for client read: we don't know data size for each page, so
01162  *   bd_iov[]->kiov_len is set to PAGE_SIZE, but actual data received might
01163  *   be smaller, so we need to adjust it according to
01164  *   bd_u.bd_kiov.bd_enc_vec[]->kiov_len.
01165  *   this means we DO NOT support the situation that server send an odd size
01166  *   data in a page which is not the last one.
01167  * - for server write: we knows exactly data size for each page being expected,
01168  *   thus kiov_len is accurate already, so we should not adjust it at all.
01169  *   and bd_u.bd_kiov.bd_enc_vec[]->kiov_len should be
01170  *   round_up(bd_iov[]->kiov_len) which
01171  *   should have been done by prep_bulk().
01172  */
01173 static
01174 int krb5_decrypt_bulk(struct crypto_blkcipher *tfm,
01175                       struct krb5_header *khdr,
01176                       struct ptlrpc_bulk_desc *desc,
01177                       rawobj_t *cipher,
01178                       rawobj_t *plain,
01179                       int adj_nob)
01180 {
01181         struct blkcipher_desc   ciph_desc;
01182         __u8                    local_iv[16] = {0};
01183         struct scatterlist      src, dst;
01184         struct sg_table         sg_src, sg_dst;
01185         int                     ct_nob = 0, pt_nob = 0;
01186         int                     blocksize, i, rc;
01187 
01188         LASSERT(ptlrpc_is_bulk_desc_kiov(desc->bd_type));
01189         LASSERT(desc->bd_iov_count);
01190         LASSERT(GET_ENC_KIOV(desc));
01191         LASSERT(desc->bd_nob_transferred);
01192 
01193         blocksize = crypto_blkcipher_blocksize(tfm);
01194         LASSERT(blocksize > 1);
01195         LASSERT(cipher->len == blocksize + sizeof(*khdr));
01196 
01197         ciph_desc.tfm  = tfm;
01198         ciph_desc.info = local_iv;
01199         ciph_desc.flags = 0;
01200 
01201         if (desc->bd_nob_transferred % blocksize) {
01202                 CERROR("odd transferred nob: %d\n", desc->bd_nob_transferred);
01203                 return -EPROTO;
01204         }
01205 
01206         /* decrypt head (confounder) */
01207         rc = setup_sgtable(&sg_src, &src, cipher->data, blocksize);
01208         if (rc != 0)
01209                 return rc;
01210 
01211         rc = setup_sgtable(&sg_dst, &dst, plain->data, blocksize);
01212         if (rc != 0) {
01213                 teardown_sgtable(&sg_src);
01214                 return rc;
01215         }
01216 
01217         rc = crypto_blkcipher_decrypt_iv(&ciph_desc, sg_dst.sgl,
01218                                          sg_src.sgl, blocksize);
01219 
01220         teardown_sgtable(&sg_dst);
01221         teardown_sgtable(&sg_src);
01222 
01223         if (rc) {
01224                 CERROR("error to decrypt confounder: %d\n", rc);
01225                 return rc;
01226         }
01227 
01228         for (i = 0; i < desc->bd_iov_count && ct_nob < desc->bd_nob_transferred;
01229              i++) {
01230                 if (BD_GET_ENC_KIOV(desc, i).kiov_offset % blocksize
01231                     != 0 ||
01232                     BD_GET_ENC_KIOV(desc, i).kiov_len % blocksize
01233                     != 0) {
01234                         CERROR("page %d: odd offset %u len %u, blocksize %d\n",
01235                                i, BD_GET_ENC_KIOV(desc, i).kiov_offset,
01236                                BD_GET_ENC_KIOV(desc, i).kiov_len,
01237                                blocksize);
01238                         return -EFAULT;
01239                 }
01240 
01241                 if (adj_nob) {
01242                         if (ct_nob + BD_GET_ENC_KIOV(desc, i).kiov_len >
01243                             desc->bd_nob_transferred)
01244                                 BD_GET_ENC_KIOV(desc, i).kiov_len =
01245                                         desc->bd_nob_transferred - ct_nob;
01246 
01247                         BD_GET_KIOV(desc, i).kiov_len =
01248                           BD_GET_ENC_KIOV(desc, i).kiov_len;
01249                         if (pt_nob + BD_GET_ENC_KIOV(desc, i).kiov_len >
01250                             desc->bd_nob)
01251                                 BD_GET_KIOV(desc, i).kiov_len =
01252                                   desc->bd_nob - pt_nob;
01253                 } else {
01254                         /* this should be guaranteed by LNET */
01255                         LASSERT(ct_nob + BD_GET_ENC_KIOV(desc, i).
01256                                 kiov_len <=
01257                                 desc->bd_nob_transferred);
01258                         LASSERT(BD_GET_KIOV(desc, i).kiov_len <=
01259                                 BD_GET_ENC_KIOV(desc, i).kiov_len);
01260                 }
01261 
01262                 if (BD_GET_ENC_KIOV(desc, i).kiov_len == 0)
01263                         continue;
01264 
01265                 sg_init_table(&src, 1);
01266                 sg_set_page(&src, BD_GET_ENC_KIOV(desc, i).kiov_page,
01267                             BD_GET_ENC_KIOV(desc, i).kiov_len,
01268                             BD_GET_ENC_KIOV(desc, i).kiov_offset);
01269                 dst = src;
01270                 if (BD_GET_KIOV(desc, i).kiov_len % blocksize == 0)
01271                         sg_assign_page(&dst,
01272                                        BD_GET_KIOV(desc, i).kiov_page);
01273 
01274                 rc = crypto_blkcipher_decrypt_iv(&ciph_desc, &dst, &src,
01275                                                  src.length);
01276                 if (rc) {
01277                         CERROR("error to decrypt page: %d\n", rc);
01278                         return rc;
01279                 }
01280 
01281                 if (BD_GET_KIOV(desc, i).kiov_len % blocksize != 0) {
01282                         memcpy(page_address(BD_GET_KIOV(desc, i).kiov_page) +
01283                                BD_GET_KIOV(desc, i).kiov_offset,
01284                                page_address(BD_GET_ENC_KIOV(desc, i).
01285                                             kiov_page) +
01286                                BD_GET_KIOV(desc, i).kiov_offset,
01287                                BD_GET_KIOV(desc, i).kiov_len);
01288                 }
01289 
01290                 ct_nob += BD_GET_ENC_KIOV(desc, i).kiov_len;
01291                 pt_nob += BD_GET_KIOV(desc, i).kiov_len;
01292         }
01293 
01294         if (unlikely(ct_nob != desc->bd_nob_transferred)) {
01295                 CERROR("%d cipher text transferred but only %d decrypted\n",
01296                        desc->bd_nob_transferred, ct_nob);
01297                 return -EFAULT;
01298         }
01299 
01300         if (unlikely(!adj_nob && pt_nob != desc->bd_nob)) {
01301                 CERROR("%d plain text expected but only %d received\n",
01302                        desc->bd_nob, pt_nob);
01303                 return -EFAULT;
01304         }
01305 
01306         /* if needed, clear up the rest unused iovs */
01307         if (adj_nob)
01308                 while (i < desc->bd_iov_count)
01309                         BD_GET_KIOV(desc, i++).kiov_len = 0;
01310 
01311         /* decrypt tail (krb5 header) */
01312         rc = setup_sgtable(&sg_src, &src, cipher->data + blocksize,
01313                            sizeof(*khdr));
01314         if (rc != 0)
01315                 return rc;
01316 
01317         rc = setup_sgtable(&sg_dst, &dst, cipher->data + blocksize,
01318                            sizeof(*khdr));
01319         if (rc != 0) {
01320                 teardown_sgtable(&sg_src);
01321                 return rc;
01322         }
01323 
01324         rc = crypto_blkcipher_decrypt_iv(&ciph_desc, sg_dst.sgl, sg_src.sgl,
01325                                          sizeof(*khdr));
01326 
01327         teardown_sgtable(&sg_src);
01328         teardown_sgtable(&sg_dst);
01329 
01330         if (rc) {
01331                 CERROR("error to decrypt tail: %d\n", rc);
01332                 return rc;
01333         }
01334 
01335         if (memcmp(cipher->data + blocksize, khdr, sizeof(*khdr))) {
01336                 CERROR("krb5 header doesn't match\n");
01337                 return -EACCES;
01338         }
01339 
01340         return 0;
01341 }
01342 
01343 static
01344 __u32 gss_wrap_kerberos(struct gss_ctx *gctx,
01345                         rawobj_t *gsshdr,
01346                         rawobj_t *msg,
01347                         int msg_buflen,
01348                         rawobj_t *token)
01349 {
01350         struct krb5_ctx     *kctx = gctx->internal_ctx_id;
01351         struct krb5_enctype *ke = &enctypes[kctx->kc_enctype];
01352         struct krb5_header  *khdr;
01353         int                  blocksize;
01354         rawobj_t             cksum = RAWOBJ_EMPTY;
01355         rawobj_t             data_desc[3], cipher;
01356         __u8                 conf[GSS_MAX_CIPHER_BLOCK];
01357         int                  rc = 0;
01358 
01359         LASSERT(ke);
01360         LASSERT(ke->ke_conf_size <= GSS_MAX_CIPHER_BLOCK);
01361         LASSERT(kctx->kc_keye.kb_tfm == NULL ||
01362                 ke->ke_conf_size >=
01363                 crypto_blkcipher_blocksize(kctx->kc_keye.kb_tfm));
01364 
01365         /*
01366          * final token format:
01367          * ---------------------------------------------------
01368          * | krb5 header | cipher text | checksum (16 bytes) |
01369          * ---------------------------------------------------
01370          */
01371 
01372         /* fill krb5 header */
01373         LASSERT(token->len >= sizeof(*khdr));
01374         khdr = (struct krb5_header *) token->data;
01375         fill_krb5_header(kctx, khdr, 1);
01376 
01377         /* generate confounder */
01378         cfs_get_random_bytes(conf, ke->ke_conf_size);
01379 
01380         /* get encryption blocksize. note kc_keye might not associated with
01381          * a tfm, currently only for arcfour-hmac */
01382         if (kctx->kc_enctype == ENCTYPE_ARCFOUR_HMAC) {
01383                 LASSERT(kctx->kc_keye.kb_tfm == NULL);
01384                 blocksize = 1;
01385         } else {
01386                 LASSERT(kctx->kc_keye.kb_tfm);
01387                 blocksize = crypto_blkcipher_blocksize(kctx->kc_keye.kb_tfm);
01388         }
01389         LASSERT(blocksize <= ke->ke_conf_size);
01390 
01391         /* padding the message */
01392         if (add_padding(msg, msg_buflen, blocksize))
01393                 return GSS_S_FAILURE;
01394 
01395         /*
01396          * clear text layout for checksum:
01397          * ------------------------------------------------------
01398          * | confounder | gss header | clear msgs | krb5 header |
01399          * ------------------------------------------------------
01400          */
01401         data_desc[0].data = conf;
01402         data_desc[0].len = ke->ke_conf_size;
01403         data_desc[1].data = gsshdr->data;
01404         data_desc[1].len = gsshdr->len;
01405         data_desc[2].data = msg->data;
01406         data_desc[2].len = msg->len;
01407 
01408         /* compute checksum */
01409         if (krb5_make_checksum(kctx->kc_enctype, &kctx->kc_keyi,
01410                                khdr, 3, data_desc, 0, NULL, &cksum))
01411                 return GSS_S_FAILURE;
01412         LASSERT(cksum.len >= ke->ke_hash_size);
01413 
01414         /*
01415          * clear text layout for encryption:
01416          * -----------------------------------------
01417          * | confounder | clear msgs | krb5 header |
01418          * -----------------------------------------
01419          */
01420         data_desc[0].data = conf;
01421         data_desc[0].len = ke->ke_conf_size;
01422         data_desc[1].data = msg->data;
01423         data_desc[1].len = msg->len;
01424         data_desc[2].data = (__u8 *) khdr;
01425         data_desc[2].len = sizeof(*khdr);
01426 
01427         /* cipher text will be directly inplace */
01428         cipher.data = (__u8 *) (khdr + 1);
01429         cipher.len = token->len - sizeof(*khdr);
01430         LASSERT(cipher.len >= ke->ke_conf_size + msg->len + sizeof(*khdr));
01431 
01432         if (kctx->kc_enctype == ENCTYPE_ARCFOUR_HMAC) {
01433                 rawobj_t                 arc4_keye;
01434                 struct crypto_blkcipher *arc4_tfm;
01435 
01436                 if (krb5_make_checksum(ENCTYPE_ARCFOUR_HMAC, &kctx->kc_keyi,
01437                                        NULL, 1, &cksum, 0, NULL, &arc4_keye)) {
01438                         CERROR("failed to obtain arc4 enc key\n");
01439                         GOTO(arc4_out, rc = -EACCES);
01440                 }
01441 
01442                 arc4_tfm = crypto_alloc_blkcipher("ecb(arc4)", 0, 0);
01443                 if (IS_ERR(arc4_tfm)) {
01444                         CERROR("failed to alloc tfm arc4 in ECB mode\n");
01445                         GOTO(arc4_out_key, rc = -EACCES);
01446                 }
01447 
01448                 if (crypto_blkcipher_setkey(arc4_tfm, arc4_keye.data,
01449                                                arc4_keye.len)) {
01450                         CERROR("failed to set arc4 key, len %d\n",
01451                                arc4_keye.len);
01452                         GOTO(arc4_out_tfm, rc = -EACCES);
01453                 }
01454 
01455                 rc = krb5_encrypt_rawobjs(arc4_tfm, 1,
01456                                           3, data_desc, &cipher, 1);
01457 arc4_out_tfm:
01458                 crypto_free_blkcipher(arc4_tfm);
01459 arc4_out_key:
01460                 rawobj_free(&arc4_keye);
01461 arc4_out:
01462                 do {} while(0); /* just to avoid compile warning */
01463         } else {
01464                 rc = krb5_encrypt_rawobjs(kctx->kc_keye.kb_tfm, 0,
01465                                           3, data_desc, &cipher, 1);
01466         }
01467 
01468         if (rc != 0) {
01469                 rawobj_free(&cksum);
01470                 return GSS_S_FAILURE;
01471         }
01472 
01473         /* fill in checksum */
01474         LASSERT(token->len >= sizeof(*khdr) + cipher.len + ke->ke_hash_size);
01475         memcpy((char *)(khdr + 1) + cipher.len,
01476                cksum.data + cksum.len - ke->ke_hash_size,
01477                ke->ke_hash_size);
01478         rawobj_free(&cksum);
01479 
01480         /* final token length */
01481         token->len = sizeof(*khdr) + cipher.len + ke->ke_hash_size;
01482         return GSS_S_COMPLETE;
01483 }
01484 
01485 static
01486 __u32 gss_prep_bulk_kerberos(struct gss_ctx *gctx,
01487                              struct ptlrpc_bulk_desc *desc)
01488 {
01489         struct krb5_ctx     *kctx = gctx->internal_ctx_id;
01490         int                  blocksize, i;
01491 
01492         LASSERT(ptlrpc_is_bulk_desc_kiov(desc->bd_type));
01493         LASSERT(desc->bd_iov_count);
01494         LASSERT(GET_ENC_KIOV(desc));
01495         LASSERT(kctx->kc_keye.kb_tfm);
01496 
01497         blocksize = crypto_blkcipher_blocksize(kctx->kc_keye.kb_tfm);
01498 
01499         for (i = 0; i < desc->bd_iov_count; i++) {
01500                 LASSERT(BD_GET_ENC_KIOV(desc, i).kiov_page);
01501                 /*
01502                  * offset should always start at page boundary of either
01503                  * client or server side.
01504                  */
01505                 if (BD_GET_KIOV(desc, i).kiov_offset & blocksize) {
01506                         CERROR("odd offset %d in page %d\n",
01507                                BD_GET_KIOV(desc, i).kiov_offset, i);
01508                         return GSS_S_FAILURE;
01509                 }
01510 
01511                 BD_GET_ENC_KIOV(desc, i).kiov_offset =
01512                         BD_GET_KIOV(desc, i).kiov_offset;
01513                 BD_GET_ENC_KIOV(desc, i).kiov_len =
01514                         (BD_GET_KIOV(desc, i).kiov_len +
01515                          blocksize - 1) & (~(blocksize - 1));
01516         }
01517 
01518         return GSS_S_COMPLETE;
01519 }
01520 
01521 static
01522 __u32 gss_wrap_bulk_kerberos(struct gss_ctx *gctx,
01523                              struct ptlrpc_bulk_desc *desc,
01524                              rawobj_t *token, int adj_nob)
01525 {
01526         struct krb5_ctx     *kctx = gctx->internal_ctx_id;
01527         struct krb5_enctype *ke = &enctypes[kctx->kc_enctype];
01528         struct krb5_header  *khdr;
01529         int                  blocksize;
01530         rawobj_t             cksum = RAWOBJ_EMPTY;
01531         rawobj_t             data_desc[1], cipher;
01532         __u8                 conf[GSS_MAX_CIPHER_BLOCK];
01533         int                  rc = 0;
01534 
01535         LASSERT(ptlrpc_is_bulk_desc_kiov(desc->bd_type));
01536         LASSERT(ke);
01537         LASSERT(ke->ke_conf_size <= GSS_MAX_CIPHER_BLOCK);
01538 
01539         /*
01540          * final token format:
01541          * --------------------------------------------------
01542          * | krb5 header | head/tail cipher text | checksum |
01543          * --------------------------------------------------
01544          */
01545 
01546         /* fill krb5 header */
01547         LASSERT(token->len >= sizeof(*khdr));
01548         khdr = (struct krb5_header *) token->data;
01549         fill_krb5_header(kctx, khdr, 1);
01550 
01551         /* generate confounder */
01552         cfs_get_random_bytes(conf, ke->ke_conf_size);
01553 
01554         /* get encryption blocksize. note kc_keye might not associated with
01555          * a tfm, currently only for arcfour-hmac */
01556         if (kctx->kc_enctype == ENCTYPE_ARCFOUR_HMAC) {
01557                 LASSERT(kctx->kc_keye.kb_tfm == NULL);
01558                 blocksize = 1;
01559         } else {
01560                 LASSERT(kctx->kc_keye.kb_tfm);
01561                 blocksize = crypto_blkcipher_blocksize(kctx->kc_keye.kb_tfm);
01562         }
01563 
01564         /*
01565          * we assume the size of krb5_header (16 bytes) must be n * blocksize.
01566          * the bulk token size would be exactly (sizeof(krb5_header) +
01567          * blocksize + sizeof(krb5_header) + hashsize)
01568          */
01569         LASSERT(blocksize <= ke->ke_conf_size);
01570         LASSERT(sizeof(*khdr) >= blocksize && sizeof(*khdr) % blocksize == 0);
01571         LASSERT(token->len >= sizeof(*khdr) + blocksize + sizeof(*khdr) + 16);
01572 
01573         /*
01574          * clear text layout for checksum:
01575          * ------------------------------------------
01576          * | confounder | clear pages | krb5 header |
01577          * ------------------------------------------
01578          */
01579         data_desc[0].data = conf;
01580         data_desc[0].len = ke->ke_conf_size;
01581 
01582         /* compute checksum */
01583         if (krb5_make_checksum(kctx->kc_enctype, &kctx->kc_keyi,
01584                                khdr, 1, data_desc,
01585                                desc->bd_iov_count, GET_KIOV(desc),
01586                                &cksum))
01587                 return GSS_S_FAILURE;
01588         LASSERT(cksum.len >= ke->ke_hash_size);
01589 
01590         /*
01591          * clear text layout for encryption:
01592          * ------------------------------------------
01593          * | confounder | clear pages | krb5 header |
01594          * ------------------------------------------
01595          *        |              |             |
01596          *        ----------  (cipher pages)   |
01597          * result token:   |                   |
01598          * -------------------------------------------
01599          * | krb5 header | cipher text | cipher text |
01600          * -------------------------------------------
01601          */
01602         data_desc[0].data = conf;
01603         data_desc[0].len = ke->ke_conf_size;
01604 
01605         cipher.data = (__u8 *) (khdr + 1);
01606         cipher.len = blocksize + sizeof(*khdr);
01607 
01608         if (kctx->kc_enctype == ENCTYPE_ARCFOUR_HMAC) {
01609                 LBUG();
01610                 rc = 0;
01611         } else {
01612                 rc = krb5_encrypt_bulk(kctx->kc_keye.kb_tfm, khdr,
01613                                        conf, desc, &cipher, adj_nob);
01614         }
01615 
01616         if (rc != 0) {
01617                 rawobj_free(&cksum);
01618                 return GSS_S_FAILURE;
01619         }
01620 
01621         /* fill in checksum */
01622         LASSERT(token->len >= sizeof(*khdr) + cipher.len + ke->ke_hash_size);
01623         memcpy((char *)(khdr + 1) + cipher.len,
01624                cksum.data + cksum.len - ke->ke_hash_size,
01625                ke->ke_hash_size);
01626         rawobj_free(&cksum);
01627 
01628         /* final token length */
01629         token->len = sizeof(*khdr) + cipher.len + ke->ke_hash_size;
01630         return GSS_S_COMPLETE;
01631 }
01632 
01633 static
01634 __u32 gss_unwrap_kerberos(struct gss_ctx  *gctx,
01635                           rawobj_t        *gsshdr,
01636                           rawobj_t        *token,
01637                           rawobj_t        *msg)
01638 {
01639         struct krb5_ctx     *kctx = gctx->internal_ctx_id;
01640         struct krb5_enctype *ke = &enctypes[kctx->kc_enctype];
01641         struct krb5_header  *khdr;
01642         unsigned char       *tmpbuf;
01643         int                  blocksize, bodysize;
01644         rawobj_t             cksum = RAWOBJ_EMPTY;
01645         rawobj_t             cipher_in, plain_out;
01646         rawobj_t             hash_objs[3];
01647         int                  rc = 0;
01648         __u32                major;
01649 
01650         LASSERT(ke);
01651 
01652         if (token->len < sizeof(*khdr)) {
01653                 CERROR("short signature: %u\n", token->len);
01654                 return GSS_S_DEFECTIVE_TOKEN;
01655         }
01656 
01657         khdr = (struct krb5_header *) token->data;
01658 
01659         major = verify_krb5_header(kctx, khdr, 1);
01660         if (major != GSS_S_COMPLETE) {
01661                 CERROR("bad krb5 header\n");
01662                 return major;
01663         }
01664 
01665         /* block size */
01666         if (kctx->kc_enctype == ENCTYPE_ARCFOUR_HMAC) {
01667                 LASSERT(kctx->kc_keye.kb_tfm == NULL);
01668                 blocksize = 1;
01669         } else {
01670                 LASSERT(kctx->kc_keye.kb_tfm);
01671                 blocksize = crypto_blkcipher_blocksize(kctx->kc_keye.kb_tfm);
01672         }
01673 
01674         /* expected token layout:
01675          * ----------------------------------------
01676          * | krb5 header | cipher text | checksum |
01677          * ----------------------------------------
01678          */
01679         bodysize = token->len - sizeof(*khdr) - ke->ke_hash_size;
01680 
01681         if (bodysize % blocksize) {
01682                 CERROR("odd bodysize %d\n", bodysize);
01683                 return GSS_S_DEFECTIVE_TOKEN;
01684         }
01685 
01686         if (bodysize <= ke->ke_conf_size + sizeof(*khdr)) {
01687                 CERROR("incomplete token: bodysize %d\n", bodysize);
01688                 return GSS_S_DEFECTIVE_TOKEN;
01689         }
01690 
01691         if (msg->len < bodysize - ke->ke_conf_size - sizeof(*khdr)) {
01692                 CERROR("buffer too small: %u, require %d\n",
01693                        msg->len, bodysize - ke->ke_conf_size);
01694                 return GSS_S_FAILURE;
01695         }
01696 
01697         /* decrypting */
01698         OBD_ALLOC_LARGE(tmpbuf, bodysize);
01699         if (!tmpbuf)
01700                 return GSS_S_FAILURE;
01701 
01702         major = GSS_S_FAILURE;
01703 
01704         cipher_in.data = (__u8 *) (khdr + 1);
01705         cipher_in.len = bodysize;
01706         plain_out.data = tmpbuf;
01707         plain_out.len = bodysize;
01708 
01709         if (kctx->kc_enctype == ENCTYPE_ARCFOUR_HMAC) {
01710                 rawobj_t                 arc4_keye;
01711                 struct crypto_blkcipher *arc4_tfm;
01712 
01713                 cksum.data = token->data + token->len - ke->ke_hash_size;
01714                 cksum.len = ke->ke_hash_size;
01715 
01716                 if (krb5_make_checksum(ENCTYPE_ARCFOUR_HMAC, &kctx->kc_keyi,
01717                                        NULL, 1, &cksum, 0, NULL, &arc4_keye)) {
01718                         CERROR("failed to obtain arc4 enc key\n");
01719                         GOTO(arc4_out, rc = -EACCES);
01720                 }
01721 
01722                 arc4_tfm = crypto_alloc_blkcipher("ecb(arc4)", 0, 0);
01723                 if (IS_ERR(arc4_tfm)) {
01724                         CERROR("failed to alloc tfm arc4 in ECB mode\n");
01725                         GOTO(arc4_out_key, rc = -EACCES);
01726                 }
01727 
01728                 if (crypto_blkcipher_setkey(arc4_tfm,
01729                                          arc4_keye.data, arc4_keye.len)) {
01730                         CERROR("failed to set arc4 key, len %d\n",
01731                                arc4_keye.len);
01732                         GOTO(arc4_out_tfm, rc = -EACCES);
01733                 }
01734 
01735                 rc = krb5_encrypt_rawobjs(arc4_tfm, 1,
01736                                           1, &cipher_in, &plain_out, 0);
01737 arc4_out_tfm:
01738                 crypto_free_blkcipher(arc4_tfm);
01739 arc4_out_key:
01740                 rawobj_free(&arc4_keye);
01741 arc4_out:
01742                 cksum = RAWOBJ_EMPTY;
01743         } else {
01744                 rc = krb5_encrypt_rawobjs(kctx->kc_keye.kb_tfm, 0,
01745                                           1, &cipher_in, &plain_out, 0);
01746         }
01747 
01748         if (rc != 0) {
01749                 CERROR("error decrypt\n");
01750                 goto out_free;
01751         }
01752         LASSERT(plain_out.len == bodysize);
01753 
01754         /* expected clear text layout:
01755          * -----------------------------------------
01756          * | confounder | clear msgs | krb5 header |
01757          * -----------------------------------------
01758          */
01759 
01760         /* verify krb5 header in token is not modified */
01761         if (memcmp(khdr, plain_out.data + plain_out.len - sizeof(*khdr),
01762                    sizeof(*khdr))) {
01763                 CERROR("decrypted krb5 header mismatch\n");
01764                 goto out_free;
01765         }
01766 
01767         /* verify checksum, compose clear text as layout:
01768          * ------------------------------------------------------
01769          * | confounder | gss header | clear msgs | krb5 header |
01770          * ------------------------------------------------------
01771          */
01772         hash_objs[0].len = ke->ke_conf_size;
01773         hash_objs[0].data = plain_out.data;
01774         hash_objs[1].len = gsshdr->len;
01775         hash_objs[1].data = gsshdr->data;
01776         hash_objs[2].len = plain_out.len - ke->ke_conf_size - sizeof(*khdr);
01777         hash_objs[2].data = plain_out.data + ke->ke_conf_size;
01778         if (krb5_make_checksum(kctx->kc_enctype, &kctx->kc_keyi,
01779                                khdr, 3, hash_objs, 0, NULL, &cksum))
01780                 goto out_free;
01781 
01782         LASSERT(cksum.len >= ke->ke_hash_size);
01783         if (memcmp((char *)(khdr + 1) + bodysize,
01784                    cksum.data + cksum.len - ke->ke_hash_size,
01785                    ke->ke_hash_size)) {
01786                 CERROR("checksum mismatch\n");
01787                 goto out_free;
01788         }
01789 
01790         msg->len =  bodysize - ke->ke_conf_size - sizeof(*khdr);
01791         memcpy(msg->data, tmpbuf + ke->ke_conf_size, msg->len);
01792 
01793         major = GSS_S_COMPLETE;
01794 out_free:
01795         OBD_FREE_LARGE(tmpbuf, bodysize);
01796         rawobj_free(&cksum);
01797         return major;
01798 }
01799 
01800 static
01801 __u32 gss_unwrap_bulk_kerberos(struct gss_ctx *gctx,
01802                                struct ptlrpc_bulk_desc *desc,
01803                                rawobj_t *token, int adj_nob)
01804 {
01805         struct krb5_ctx     *kctx = gctx->internal_ctx_id;
01806         struct krb5_enctype *ke = &enctypes[kctx->kc_enctype];
01807         struct krb5_header  *khdr;
01808         int                  blocksize;
01809         rawobj_t             cksum = RAWOBJ_EMPTY;
01810         rawobj_t             cipher, plain;
01811         rawobj_t             data_desc[1];
01812         int                  rc;
01813         __u32                major;
01814 
01815         LASSERT(ptlrpc_is_bulk_desc_kiov(desc->bd_type));
01816         LASSERT(ke);
01817 
01818         if (token->len < sizeof(*khdr)) {
01819                 CERROR("short signature: %u\n", token->len);
01820                 return GSS_S_DEFECTIVE_TOKEN;
01821         }
01822 
01823         khdr = (struct krb5_header *) token->data;
01824 
01825         major = verify_krb5_header(kctx, khdr, 1);
01826         if (major != GSS_S_COMPLETE) {
01827                 CERROR("bad krb5 header\n");
01828                 return major;
01829         }
01830 
01831         /* block size */
01832         if (kctx->kc_enctype == ENCTYPE_ARCFOUR_HMAC) {
01833                 LASSERT(kctx->kc_keye.kb_tfm == NULL);
01834                 blocksize = 1;
01835                 LBUG();
01836         } else {
01837                 LASSERT(kctx->kc_keye.kb_tfm);
01838                 blocksize = crypto_blkcipher_blocksize(kctx->kc_keye.kb_tfm);
01839         }
01840         LASSERT(sizeof(*khdr) >= blocksize && sizeof(*khdr) % blocksize == 0);
01841 
01842         /*
01843          * token format is expected as:
01844          * -----------------------------------------------
01845          * | krb5 header | head/tail cipher text | cksum |
01846          * -----------------------------------------------
01847          */
01848         if (token->len < sizeof(*khdr) + blocksize + sizeof(*khdr) +
01849                          ke->ke_hash_size) {
01850                 CERROR("short token size: %u\n", token->len);
01851                 return GSS_S_DEFECTIVE_TOKEN;
01852         }
01853 
01854         cipher.data = (__u8 *) (khdr + 1);
01855         cipher.len = blocksize + sizeof(*khdr);
01856         plain.data = cipher.data;
01857         plain.len = cipher.len;
01858 
01859         rc = krb5_decrypt_bulk(kctx->kc_keye.kb_tfm, khdr,
01860                                desc, &cipher, &plain, adj_nob);
01861         if (rc)
01862                 return GSS_S_DEFECTIVE_TOKEN;
01863 
01864         /*
01865          * verify checksum, compose clear text as layout:
01866          * ------------------------------------------
01867          * | confounder | clear pages | krb5 header |
01868          * ------------------------------------------
01869          */
01870         data_desc[0].data = plain.data;
01871         data_desc[0].len = blocksize;
01872 
01873         if (krb5_make_checksum(kctx->kc_enctype, &kctx->kc_keyi,
01874                                khdr, 1, data_desc,
01875                                desc->bd_iov_count,
01876                                GET_KIOV(desc),
01877                                &cksum))
01878                 return GSS_S_FAILURE;
01879         LASSERT(cksum.len >= ke->ke_hash_size);
01880 
01881         if (memcmp(plain.data + blocksize + sizeof(*khdr),
01882                    cksum.data + cksum.len - ke->ke_hash_size,
01883                    ke->ke_hash_size)) {
01884                 CERROR("checksum mismatch\n");
01885                 rawobj_free(&cksum);
01886                 return GSS_S_BAD_SIG;
01887         }
01888 
01889         rawobj_free(&cksum);
01890         return GSS_S_COMPLETE;
01891 }
01892 
01893 int gss_display_kerberos(struct gss_ctx        *ctx,
01894                          char                  *buf,
01895                          int                    bufsize)
01896 {
01897         struct krb5_ctx    *kctx = ctx->internal_ctx_id;
01898         int                 written;
01899 
01900         written = snprintf(buf, bufsize, "krb5 (%s)",
01901                            enctype2str(kctx->kc_enctype));
01902         return written;
01903 }

01951         .gm_owner       = NULL, /*THIS_MODULE, */
01952         .gm_name        = "krb5",
01953         .gm_oid         = (rawobj_t)
01954                                 {9, "\052\206\110\206\367\022\001\002\002"},
01955         .gm_ops         = &gss_kerberos_ops,

01957         .gm_sfs         = gss_kerberos_sfs,

01959 
01960 int __init init_kerberos_module(void)
01961 {
01962         int status;
01963 
01964         spin_lock_init(&krb5_seq_lock);
01965 
01966         status = lgss_mech_register(&gss_kerberos_mech);
01967         if (status)
01968                 CERROR("Failed to register kerberos gss mechanism!\n");
01969         return status;
01970 }
01971 
01972 void cleanup_kerberos_module(void)
01973 {
01974         lgss_mech_unregister(&gss_kerberos_mech);
01975 }
